verses.kjv: O Lord, thou art my God; I will exalt thee, I will praise thy name; for thou hast done wonderful things; thy counsels of old are faithfulness and truth.
verses.web: LORD, you are my God. I will exalt you! I will praise your name, for you have done wonderful things, things planned long ago, in complete faithfulness and truth.
verses.ct: LORD, you are my God. I will lift you up and praise your name, because you have done amazing things. Your plans, made long ago, have come true with perfect faithfulness and truth.

verses.kjv: For thou hast made of a city an heap; of a defenced city a ruin: a palace of strangers to be no city; it shall never be built.
verses.web: For you have made a city into a heap, a fortified city into a ruin, a palace of strangers to be no city. It will never be built.
verses.ct: You have turned a city into a pile of rubble, a fortified city into ruins. The foreigners' palace is a city no more — it will never be rebuilt.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall the strong people glorify thee, the city of the terrible nations shall fear thee.
verses.web: Therefore a strong people will glorify you. A city of awesome nations will fear you.
verses.ct: Because of this, powerful nations will honor you, and cities of ruthless peoples will fear you.

verses.kjv: For thou hast been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat, when the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.
verses.web: For you have been a stronghold to the poor, a stronghold to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shade from the heat, when the blast of the dreaded ones is like a storm against the wall.
verses.ct: You have been a fortress for the poor, a fortress for the needy in their distress, a shelter from the storm, and shade from the scorching heat. The fury of ruthless oppressors hits like a storm beating against a wall,

verses.kjv: Thou shalt bring down the noise of strangers, as the heat in a dry place; even the heat with the shadow of a cloud: the branch of the terrible ones shall be brought low.
verses.web: As the heat in a dry place you will bring down the noise of strangers; as the heat by the shade of a cloud, the song of the dreaded ones will be brought low.
verses.ct: but you silence the uproar of foreigners the way a cloud's shadow cools the desert heat. The triumphant shouts of the ruthless are cut short.

verses.kjv: And in this mountain shall the LORD of hosts make unto all people a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.
verses.web: In this mountain, LORD of Armies will make all peoples a feast of choice meat, a feast of choice wines, of choice meat full of marrow, of well refined choice wines.
verses.ct: On this mountain, the LORD of hosts will prepare a feast for all peoples — a banquet of rich food and the finest aged wines, tender meat full of marrow and perfectly refined wine.

verses.kjv: And he will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering cast over all people, and the vail that is spread over all nations.
verses.web: He will destroy in this mountain the surface of the covering that covers all peoples, and the veil that is spread over all nations.
verses.ct: On this mountain he will destroy the shroud that covers all peoples, the veil that is draped over every nation.

verses.kjv: He will swallow up death in victory; and the Lord GOD will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the rebuke of his people shall he take away from off all the earth: for the LORD hath spoken it.
verses.web: He has swallowed up death forever! The Lord LORD will wipe away tears from off all faces. He will take the reproach of his people away from off all the earth, for LORD has spoken it.
verses.ct: He will swallow up death forever! The Lord GOD will wipe away tears from every face. He will remove the disgrace his people have endured throughout the earth, for the LORD has spoken it.

verses.kjv: And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the LORD; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.
verses.web: It shall be said in that day, “Behold, this is our God! We have waited for him, and he will save us! This is LORD! We have waited for him. We will be glad and rejoice in his salvation!”
verses.ct: On that day, people will say, "Look — this is our God! We waited for him, and he has saved us! This is the LORD! We waited for him, and now we will celebrate and rejoice in his salvation!"

verses.kjv: For in this mountain shall the hand of the LORD rest, and Moab shall be trodden down under him, even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.
verses.web: For LORD’s hand will rest in this mountain. Moab will be trodden down in his place, even like straw is trodden down in the water of the dunghill.
verses.ct: The LORD's hand will rest on this mountain, but Moab will be trampled down like straw crushed into a manure pile.

verses.kjv: And he shall spread forth his hands in the midst of them, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth his hands to swim: and he shall bring down their pride together with the spoils of their hands.
verses.web: He will spread out his hands in the middle of it, like one who swims spreads out hands to swim, but his pride will be humbled together with the craft of his hands.
verses.ct: Moab will stretch out its hands in the middle of it, like a swimmer reaching out to swim, but the LORD will bring down their pride along with everything their hands have gained.

verses.kjv: And the fortress of the high fort of thy walls shall he bring down, lay low, and bring to the ground, even to the dust.
verses.web: He has brought the high fortress of your walls down, laid low, and brought to the ground, even to the dust.
verses.ct: He will tear down your high, fortified walls, bring them crashing to the ground, and reduce them to dust.
